intro: Centrolepis platychlamys, commonly known as the broad-chambered grass. It is a unique member of the Restionaceae family, native to South Africa. The plant is characterized by its compact, tussock-like growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Centrolepis platychlamys is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
